RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Special Weight Purse 10700. FOR COLORADO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPECIAL TWIST stalked the pace from the inside then slipped thru at the top of the stretch and drew clear. JUST A SEC sprinted to a clear lead and was over taken at the top of the stretch but was clearly second best. LAST AMIGA had no early speed while saving ground and passed tiring rivals. PIZZA GIRL tracked the leaders to the top of the stretch and gave way. IMA HAPPY DANCER was off the pace from three wide and failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Special Twist
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, slipped thru, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Last Amiga
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, saved ground, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Just a Sec
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, over taken, clearly 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 6000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ENDALE ARCH shared the command to the half mile marker then edged away and kept to task in the drive. EL JEFE COBB raced in the middle of the pace to the turn then made a rail bid around the turn but couldn't catch the leader but was a game second. CREDIT RATING raced near the back to the turn then circled the field and rallied for the show. DALE'S ADDICTION shared the command to the half mile marker then tracked the leader around the turn and tired. BIG BLUE OKIE trailed the field to the turn then moved up from four or five wide around the turn and into the stretch and showed late interest to improve position. MAJOR TIMING had brief early speed then settled off the pace from three wide to the five sixteenths pole and weakened. FUSAICHI WILDCAT was off the pave from four wide to the three furlong marked and gave way. BUZZ SHINER raced wide down the backstretch then angled in on the turn to save ground but was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Endale Arch
ENTRY.COMMENT: share command, edged away, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: El Jefe Cobb
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, rail bid turn, couldn't catch, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Fusaichi Wildcat
ENTRY.OWNER: Rust Terri and Barton Ranch Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Buzz Shiner
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide backstretch, angled in turn, no factor,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 6000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUICK SANDY was off the pace from three wide through the turn then engaged the leader at the three sixteenths pole and drove past to prove best. COWGIRLLOVER stalked the pace from four wide down the backstretch then moved in to three wide and engaged the leader at the three sixteenths pole and fought gamely in the stretch but was no match for the winner. SPARKLE IN THE SKY rushed up to a clear lead through the turn then was headed at the three sixteenths pole and gave way grudgingly. ITHOUGHTIKNEW was allowed to settle near the back through the turn then moved out to five wide in upper stretch for a late rallly. HIGH ON LIFE raced in the middle of the pack but failed to menace. AUNT CARI raced in the middle of the pack from three to five wide and lacked a late reponse. WHEREDIDITGO raced in the middle of the pack around the turn then moved up between horses at the three sixteenths and faltered. KINSLEYS SWEET PEA was off the pace in the two path to the half mile marker and retreated. SHADOWINTHECLOUDS saved ground to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Sparkle in the Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, headed 3/16, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: High On Life
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Quick Sandy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, engaged leader 3/16, drove past, best

ENTRY.NAME: Cowgirllover
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4w, engaged leader 3/16, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Aunt Cari
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 3-5w, lacked late response,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 6800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $3500 OR LESS IN 2022-2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $5000 OR COLORADO BRED CLAIMING PRICE $6250. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Pr ice $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUEZ tracked the leaders down the backstretch then fell back on the turn but made a rebid at the three sixteenths and gave a late surge from between horses at the sixteenth pole to just get up for the win. OPTIMAL was off the pace down the backstretch then chased the leader around the turn and drove past in the final sixteenth to take a brief lead but was nailed in the final jumps. THREE BALL was forwardly placed down the backstretch, fell back on the turn but made a rebid at the top of the stretch for a late run to be up for show. MOST AMUSING sprinted to a clear lead to set the pace but was collared in the final sixteenths and gave way. CHUCK NAZTY was last away, rushed up the rail to be in contention and was gaining in the stretch drive but was outfinished. CREATIVE LETTERS was outrun. PODEROSO EQUS was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Optimal
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, chased turn, drove past, brief lead, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Chuck Nazty
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, rushed up rail, gaining, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Most Amusing
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, set pace, collared 1/16, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Suez
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, fell back turn, rebid 3/16, late surge, just up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Michael E. Pegram, Karl Watson & Paul Weitman

ENTRY.NAME: Three Ball
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, fell back turn, rebid, late effort

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 12500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF THREE RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHISTLING HOME was hustled to the lead under pressure to the quarter pole, inched away into the stretch and drew off to prove best. LOTSA LACE shot away from the gate then vied for the lead from three wide to the quarter pole and chased the winner home. MISFIRED raced near the back on the backstretch then made a bid around the turn, tipped in to make a rail bid in the stretch and was up for the show. DREAMER GIRL vied for the lead from the two path then tracked the leaders from three wide around the turn but was empty. UNPLUCKED GEM failed to menace. TRULY A MESS was bumped by inside rival at the start then trailed down the backstretch, made a rail bid on the turn, tipped out to two wide into the stretch but tired. NAUGHTY EVELYN bumped outside rival at the start then tracked the leaders, angled out to four wide at the half mile marker and vied for the lead for a furlong and gave way. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED THE JOCKEY OF TRULY A MESS CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF MISFIRED FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE AT THE START, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS DISALLOWED AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Whistling Home
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, inched away, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Truly a Mess
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, trailed, rail bid turn, 2wupper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Misfired
ENTRY.OWNER: Rust Terri and Rusty Wire Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, bid turn, rail bid stretch, up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamer Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, tracked 3w turn, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Unplucked Gem
ENTRY.OWNER: Rushton Stacey Eskew Stuart and Alfrey Vance

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CELEE'S LAST TE went to the front to set an unchallenged pace, drew off to prove best. RAY AREWETHEREYET stalked the pace from three wide and fought gamely in the stretch, held the place. INTO CLASSIC tracked the leaders from two wide and fought gamely in the stretch but flattened out. MISS IMPORTANT trailed the field to the turn then made a rail bid on the turn to improve position. DIRT FLIRT was close up to the turn while racing four wide throughout and was not a factor. RED HOT MOON settled near the back and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Celee's Last Te
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, unchallenged, drew off, best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Cherry Creek Futurity ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 7 350 Y Dirt CR: 75. Futurity Purse 94160. 2 YEAR OLD COLORADO BREDS WHICH HAVE QUALIFIED FOR THE FINAL. Weight 124 lbs. Runs: Sunday August 6 Trials: Monday July 24. Closes: Sunday July 30. To nominate contact RMQHA.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIX GOOD KICKS sprinted away, best. LA CORONEL gamely, held 2nd. BIANCAS FLARE late kick. FIRST SWEETS strong effort. PS MISS DAISY steady effort. SEPARTIST KICKER no menace. A BEAUTIFUL FLARE stumbled start. LIEBRITA stumbled start. CRYSTAL N DIAMOND ducked in, hit rail. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE START OF THE RACE, AFTER A REVIEW CRYSTAL N DIAMOND WAS THE CAUSE OF IT OWN PROBLEMS AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Lucille Rowe Derby ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 8 350 Y Dirt CR: 84. Derby Purse 49450. THREE YEAR OLD COLORADO BREDS WHICH HAVE QUALIFIED FOR THE FINAL. Weight 124 lbs. Runs: Sunday August 6 Trials: Monday July 24. Closes: July 30. Nominations contact RMQHA.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIABOLICAL CLYDE strong driving finish. COUNTRY ROCKET FOOSE late surge for place. KISS FOR MONEY drifted out, fought hard. FEARLESS FORTITUDE closed well. LIGHTNING JESS strong drive. MALALA bumped, mid pack duel. CORONAS FOR IVORY bumped, mid pack duel. CARTEL MONEY tested rig, no factor. BIG TIME APOLLI fractious gate, outrun. RARE CREEK broke in, not involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Time Apolli
ENTRY.OWNER: Silva Alejandro and Flores Luis Fernando
